Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Master::Master ( ConnectionManagerPtr &  connManagerPtr,
PropertiesPtr &  propsPtr,
ServerKeepaliveHandlerPtr &  keepaliveHandlerPtr 
)

This constructor reads the properties file and pulls out some relevant properties.

It also sets up the m_base_dir variable to be the absolute path of the root of the Hyperspace directory (with no trailing slash). It locks this root directory to prevent concurrent masters and then reads/increments/writes the 32-bit integer extended attribute 'generation'. It also creates the server Keepalive handler.

Lock the base directory to prevent concurrent masters

Increment generation number and save

void Master::mkdir ( ResponseCallback *  cb,

const char *  name

This method creates a directory with absolute path 'name'.

It locks the parent node to prevent concurrent modifications.

Definition at line 189 of file Master.cc.

int Master::renew_session_lease ( uint64_t  sessionId  ) 

Attempts to renew the session lease for session with the given ID.

If the session cannot be found or if it is expired, the method returns Error::HYPERSPACE_EXPIRED_SESSION otherwise, it renews the session lease by invoking the RenewLease method of the SessionData object.

Parameters:
sessionId Session ID to renew
Returns:
Error::OK if successful

Definition at line 1170 of file Master.cc.

bool Master::find_parent_node ( std::string  normalName,
NodeDataPtr &  parentNodePtr,
std::string &  childName 
) [private]

Locates the parent 'node' of the given pathname.

It determines the name of the parent node by stripping off the characters incuding and after the last '/' character. It then looks up the name in the m_node_map and sets the pointer reference 'parentNodePtr' to it. As a side effect, it also saves the child name (e.g. characters after the last '/' character to the string reference childName. NOTE: This method locks the m_node_map_mutex.

Parameters:
normalName Normalized (e.g. no trailing '/') name of path to find parent of
parentNodePtr pointer reference to hold return pointer
childName reference to string to hold the child directory entry name
Returns:
true if parent node found, false otherwise
